context: A security incident involving suspicious WMI process creation was reported on the machine `vnevado-win11u`. This machine also saw multiple suspicious processes including `curl http://vectorsandarrows.com`, `vssblatemp.exe delete shadows /all`, and `get-userprttoken.ps1` on 2024-06-20. The incident is related to potential malware activity which might be using WMI to spawn new processes and further infect the machine.
question: During the investigation of this incident, there was a possible attempt to access a Primary Refresh Token (PRT). Can you identify the AadDeviceId of the host involved in this end alert?
solution_steps: A suspicious WMI process creation was observed involving the user with SID `S-1-5-21-1840191660-8534830288-125585561-1522`.
There was a possible attempt to access the Primary Refresh Token (PRT) on the host with AadDeviceId `e5799261-6720-4297-961e-bd9ca4275033`.
